Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • HumanPlayer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BotPlayer
    public class HumanPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a human controlled and contains code needed to read inputs. It also sets the player up at a random point, and allows it to move. Only 1 HumanPlayer will exist.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HumanPlayer()
      HumanPlayer constructor - sets up the game with human controlled player.

    • Method Summary

      void collectGold()

    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer()
        HumanPlayer constructor - sets up the game with human controlled player. playerGold set to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • collectGold

        public void collectGold()
        adds 1 to playerGold - run when player uses PICKUP on 'G' tile

      • getInputFromConsole

        public java.lang.String getInputFromConsole()
        gets the next line that has been typed into the console by the user and returns it as a string.
        Returns:
        scanner.nextLine() : this is the next line that has been inputted by the user, ready to be processed

      • getNextAction

        public Action getNextAction​(java.lang.String input)
        Processes the command. It returns a Action enumerator value. Otherwise it should return the string "Invalid". Converts the command to upper case so that it can be processed if any characters lower case.
        Parameters:
        input - : input received from scanner in getInputFromConsole.
        Returns:
        : Processed output

      • getPlayerGold

        public int getPlayerGold()
        Returns the boolean value of playerGold
        Returns:
        playerGold : current gold that human player has.

      • getRandPos

        public void getRandPos​(Map map)
        Sets the random start position of a player.
        Parameters:
        map - - the map that the players will be placed in

      • getXPos

        public int getXPos()
        Returns int value of XPos.
        Returns:
        XPos - current X position of player

      • getYPos

        public int getYPos()
        Returns int value of YPos.
        Returns:
        YPos - current Y position of player
